fields.headline: Critics' choice
fields.bodyText: The book Oranges in No Man's Land by Elizabeth Laird Macmillan. Price £7.99. Age 8-11yrs In a preface to her new novel, published in the wake of this summer's war in Lebanon, Elizabeth Laird recalls her own experience of life in war-torn Beirut in 1977. This, though, is the story of Ayesha, a young girl whose family, already displaced from their farm in southern Lebanon, are caught in Beirut when the bombs start falling. When her grandmother is taken ill, Ayesha realises that she needs a doctor and medicine - commodities that can only be procured from enemy territory. The account of her desperate journey is a moving portrayal of the plight of children caught up in seemingly senseless wars. Told with only minimal reference to the politics of the war, its themes are universal: human suffering, the irrationality of prejudice and the redemptive power of friendship. Fifty pence from the sale of each book is donated to Save the Children. The teacher zone explains how to invite a poet into school. www.bbc.co.uk/scotland/education/wwww/living/kids.shtml Suitable for: KS1 pupils & teachers BBC Scotland has produced some interesting riddles for children to solve. The riddles have visual solutions. www.rhymezone.com Suitable for: KS1/2 pupils & teachers A very effective and efficient online rhyming dictionary. http://teacher.scholastic.com/writewit/poetry/index.htm Suitable for: KS1/2 pupils & teachers A team of poets demonstrates how to use descriptive words and phrases, the use of rhyme and rhythm and how to have fun writing poetry. An online poetry idea engine helps pupils to write haikus, free verse, limericks and more. The CD-rom Indigo Illustrations - Animals Indigo Learning Price £75. Age 7-11yrs Over 150 images are contained within the disc, organised into mammals, birds, aquatic life, young, reptiles and a final section containing six cartoon images of a group of six or more mammals. The CD-rom contains five lesson ideas, complete with objectives and references to the national curriculum. The package is intended to supplement elements of the KS2 curriculum, mainly science, literacy and ICT. For a full evaluation of this product go to www.teem.org.uk
